page.title: 04Sheep at North Hawkwell Farm
page.content:
Mr. Schofield has 550 ewes and 700 lambs. He has two different kinds of sheep they are a Cheviot cross sheep and Suffolk sheep.
Mr. Schofield can fit a hundred and sixty sheep in his shed for lambing. He puts the sheep in the shed six weeks before lambing in March.
In the sheep handling shed he shears the sheep and weighs the lambs and drenches them. He has two shearing motors and two drenches and one sheep weighing machine. When they have sheared a sheep they tie the wool up with string. Mr Schofield does not shear his lambs and he sells his sheep wool at South Molton.
In November he sells his lambs at Cutcombe Market.
